{{ infobox football match | event = 2001 Asian Super Cup | team1 = [[Suwon Samsung Bluewings]] | team2 = [[Al-Shabab Riyadh|Al Shabab]] | team1score = 4 | team2score = 3 | firstleg = First leg | team1score1 = 2 | team2score1 = 2 | date1 = August 4, 2001 | stadium1 = | city1 = | attendance1 = | referee1 = | secondleg = Second leg | team1score2 = 2 | team2score2 = 1 | date2 = August 10, 2001 | stadium2 = | city2 = | attendance2 = | referee2 = | previous = [[2000 Asian Super Cup|2000]] | next = [[2002 Asian Super Cup|2002]] }} The '''2001 Asian Super Cup''' was the 7th [[Asian Super Cup]], a [[association football|football]] match played between the winners of the previous season's [[2000â01 Asian Club Championship#Champions|Asian Club Championship]] and [[2000â01 Asian Cup Winners' Cup#Champions|Asian Cup Winners Cup]] competitions. The 2001 competition was contested by [[Suwon Samsung Bluewings]] of [[South Korea]], who won the [[2000â01 Asian Club Championship]], and [[Al-Shabab Riyadh|Al Shabab]] of [[Saudi Arabia]], the winners of the [[2000â01 Asian Cup Winners' Cup]]. == Route to the Super Cup == === Suwon Samsung Bluewings === {{details|2000â01 Asian Club Championship}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" |- !Opponents !Round !Score1 !Suwon Samsung Bluewings goalscorers |- |{{flagicon|MDV}} [[Hurriyya]] || Second round || 2â1 || ? |- |{{flagicon|JPN}} [[JÃºbilo Iwata]] || Quarterfinals || 0â3 || |- |{{flagicon|IDN}} [[PSM Makassar]] || Quarterfinals || 8â1 || [[Seo Jung-Won]] {{goal|6}} {{goal|23}} {{goal|25}}, [[Sandro Cardoso dos Santos|Sandro Cardoso]] {{goal|11}} {{goal|18}}, [[Park Kun-Ha]] {{goal|37}}, [[Ko Jong-Soo]] {{goal|45}}([[Penalty shootout (association football)|p]]) {{goal|79}} |- |{{flagicon|CHN}} [[Shandong Luneng Taishan F.C.|Shandong Luneng Taishan]] || Quarterfinals || 6â0 || [[Ko Jong-Soo]] {{goal|8}} {{goal|38}}, [[Denis Laktionov]] {{goal|28}}, [[Seo Dong-Won]] {{goal|48}} {{goal|59}}, [[Sabo Zoltan]] {{goal|82}} |- |{{flagicon|IRN}} [[Persepolis F.C.|Persepolis]] || Semifinals || 2â1 || [[Seo Jung-Won]] {{goal|78}}, [[Park Kun-Ha]] {{goal|90}} |- |{{flagicon|JPN}} [[JÃºbilo Iwata]] || finals || 1â0 || [[Sandro Cardoso dos Santos|Sandro Cardoso]] {{goal|15}} |} 1Suwon Samsung Bluewings goals always recorded first.
=== Al Shabab === {{details|2000â01 Asian Cup Winners' Cup}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" |- !Opponents !Round !Score1 !Al Shabab goalscorers |- |{{flagicon|SYR}} [[Hutteen SC|Hutteen]] || Second round|| 2â1 || ? |- |{{flagicon|JOR}} [[Al-Wihdat Club (Amman)|Al Wahdat]] || Quarterfinals || 3â2 || ? |- |{{flagicon|IRN}} [[Esteghlal F.C.|Esteghlal]] || Semifinals || 3â2 || [[Saeed Al-Owairan]] {{goal|15}}([[Penalty shootout (association football)|p]]), [[Abdullah Bin Shehan|Abdullah Shehan]] {{goal|58}}, [[Khalid Al Dossary]] {{goal|87}} |- |{{flagicon|CHN}} [[Dalian Shide F.C.|Dalian Shide]] || Final || 4â2 || [[Abdullah Al-Waked|Abdullah Al Shahrani]] {{goal|24}} ([[Penalty shootout (association football)|p]]), [[Abdullah Sheehan]] {{goal|25}} {{goal|48}} {{goal|74}} |} 1Al Shabab goals always recorded first. == Game summary == {{TwoLeg start}} {{TwoLegResult| '''[[Suwon Samsung Bluewings]]''' | KOR | 4-3 | [[Al-Shabab (Saudi Arabia)|Al-Shabab]] | SAU | 2-2 | 2-1 |winner=1}} |} === First Game === {{footballbox |date = August 4, 2001 |team1 = [[Suwon Samsung Bluewings]] {{flagicon|KOR}} |score = 2â2 |team2 = {{flagicon|SAU}} [[Al-Shabab (Saudi Arabia)|Al-Shabab]] |goals1 = [[Denis Laktionov]] {{goal|26}}
